discourse_list.title: Are Governance decisions to increase USDC debt limit trading an increased stability of DAI for a lower value of MKR?

content.content: When I look at the MKR-ETH char for the last year+ (figure below), the value of $MKR has been steadily decreasing with respect to $ETH (from ~3.5 to the current ~1.2). I think that this steady depreciation (relative to ETH) could be due also to an steady decrease of the percentage of ETH locked and the increase of percentage of USCD locked (hypothesis). If this is true (or at least to some extend true), then MAKER Governance decisions to increase UCSD debt limit maybe trading an increased stability of DAI (thanks to more UCSD locked) in exchange for a lower value of MKR relative to ETH. Does it makes sense? If this makes sense, it would be a good thing to model this effect and present every new voting proposal with predictions of the most likely mid/long term scenarios of new Governance decisions.  image1350×756 76.9 KB

content.content: I appreciate your enthusiasm for scientific governance. Have you seen the analysis and recommendations of the Rates Working Group? They consider many factors to recommend rate changes to achieve MakerDAO goals, particularly maintaining the DAI peg. I think the general sentiment is that governance acts to ensure MakerDAO grows and thrives, but that MKR price itself is a second order effect.  I do not think it would be appropriate to include MKR price predictions as part of a proposal.
